title.narrative: Burkina Faso Electoral Process Support Project (2019-2021)

description.narrative:
UNDP office of Burkina Faso has applied to Sida for funding of 17, 55 million SEK to carry out the "Electoral Process Support Project during the period 2020-2021.
The intervention aims at organising free, transparent, credible and inclusive elections in 2020 and 2021, in accordance with international best practices. The project aims, specifically, to support the national actors to acquire the capacities of organization and management of electoral cycles answering the norms and international standards. It also aims to ensure the promotion of women and young people as well as the inclusive participation of all social strata in the exercise of their civic right for the free and informed choice of their representatives in the governing bodies.
The intervention’s total budget is 182 098 000 SEK (17 555 991 USD), out of which UNDP’s own funding is approximately 10 372 400 SEK (1 million USD), UNDP's Funding Windows is 9 061 960 SEK (873 659 USD) and the remaining 162 664 000 SEK (15 682 332 USD) is contributed by Sweden 15 MSEK, Denmark 11 857 000 SEK (8M DDK), the Switzerland 7 362 140 SEK (700 000 CHF), and the EU Commission contributes 99 833 000 (9M EUR).

UNDP:s landkontor i Burkina Faso har ansökt om 17,55 miljoner kronor för att genomföra projektet "Electoral Process Support Project during the period 2020-2021.

Insatsen syftar specifikt till att stödja nationella aktörer att bygga kapacitet att organisera och genomföra valprocessen utifrån internationella normer och standarder. Insatsen syftar även till att säkerställa kvinnor och unga människors deltagande i valet liksom ett inkluderande deltagande av alla samhällsgrupper att försvara sina medborgerliga rättigheter genom fria och informerade val av representanter i valbara församlingar.
Insatsen totala budget är 182 098 000 SEK (17 555 991 USD), av vilka UNDP finansierar ca 10 372 400 SEK (1 million USD). UNDP:s finansieringsfönster är 9 061 960 SEK (873 659 USD) och kvarvarande 162 664 000 SEK (15 682 332 USD) kommer att finansieras av följande givare: Sverige med 15 000 000 SEK, Danmark med 11 857 000 SEK (8M DDK), Schweiz med 7 362 140 SEK (700 000 CHF), och EU-kommissionen med 99 833 000 SEK (9M EUR).

title.narrative: Amendment to the agreement of Sweden Embassy to support the election UNDP

description.narrative: Component 1: Support for Capacity Building and Electoral Operations The year 2021, as a post-electoral and pre-electoral period, was devoted to capitalization of the project's activities and other INEC activities carried out in the context of the November 2020 presidential and legislative elections. An added value for a local elections planned for 2022. The conduct of a dozen or so thematic workshops with the various actors in the process, has made it possible to produce and tools that take into account the shortcomings noted during the presidential and legislative elections of November 2020 presidential and legislative elections. These tools and materials were used in the cascade training of the members of the branches and the operators of the kits. The exchanges allowed the actors to take into account the security context in the revision of the electoral law. Improved training materials, approaches and modules through the implementation of recommendations from 15 thematic capitalization workshop. Unfortunately, the 2021 work plan that was developed on the basis of the recommendations of the thematic workshops and in view of the local elections could not be fully implemented Component 2: Support for communication, civic education and awareness for greater citizen participation. The program developed a communication plan for the Independent National Electoral Commission, funded much of the communication activities, and provided communication experts to the institution. The electoral commission's website has been updated and the content improved. In collaboration with the Superior Council of Communication (CSC), the project trained 1,100 journalists from 30 media outlets on electoral ethics and the promotion of a credible and peaceful electoral process; and 200 observers on the monitoring of speeches during the electoral campaign. In total, at least 1,300 actors improved their capacity to cover critical phases of the electoral process. Component 3: Support for Electoral Conflict Prevention and Management The project has initiated citizen education and awareness-raising activities to support the effective participation of all social to support the effective participation of all social strata in local elections. However, some activities will not be able to be carried out due to the cancellation, in November 2021, of the However, some activities will not be able to be carried out due to the cancellation in November 2021 of the revision of the electoral roll. The national human rights commission has put in place tools to monitor violence before, during and after elections. This work must be continued so that violence is monitored during the electoral cycle. It should be noted that Head Office supports the West Africa Network for Peacebuilding, which also monitors violence before, during and after elections and participates in meetings of the steering committee on elections. It has prepared a report on the violence and made recommendations. Component 4: Support for the participation of women and young people The Higher Council for Communication, as well as all the actors, developed a communication manual for the electoral commission and supported awareness campaigns, but the participation of young people and women was low. the thematic workshop made recommendations to improve the participation of women and young people. The thematic workshop made recommendations to improve the participation of women and youth. It will be necessary to ensure that they are taken into account. The project sensitized 93 youth in Koudougou and 125 youth in Bobo Dioulasso to participate in a large-scale participate in a large-scale awareness campaign on youth participation in the local elections in 2022. In addition to the 1,218 participants in the presidential elections, a thousand Internet users followed the exchanges on Face Book. A hundred of these young people have committed to conducting youth mobilization activities at the end of the workshops. At the Management Level During the year 2021, the Program organized 15 capitalization workshops on the following themes 1. women's political participation 2. the early warning system 3. management of electoral disputes 4. political participation of young people 5. reform of the legal framework 6. logistics and the candidacy database 7. the electoral register and the mechanism for transmitting voting results; 8. electoral communication strategy 9. Training of electoral staff; 10 support from United Nations Volunteers (UNV). These workshops produced a summary report containing the various recommendations. These recommendations should be followed up during the transition period and beyond by the Electoral Commission and all stakeholders. Out of a budget of 17,555,991 USD (initial PRODOC), the project has mobilized 16,768,374 USD (cumulative contributions) which corresponds to 156,969,195.42 Swedish Kronor, a rate of 95.51%. Subject to adjustments to be made at the close of the fiscal year, as of December 31, 2021, the project has committed a cumulative total of US $12,765,33426 during the years 2020 and 2021; giving a cumulative implementation rate of 76.12%27 (rate based on resources disbursed).It should be noted that the contribution from Italy, received in December 2020, has been used in the framework of the implementation of the Annual work plan 2021. UNDP had submitted a request for gap funding at the program level. The Swedish Embassy had accepted and contributed SEK 8 million. Initially the contribution of the Swedish Embassy was SEK 15 million. With the coup, the Swedish embassy believes that the electoral cycle is over. According to the contract, the UNDP must make a situation report and reimburse the unused funds. In addition, the political situation in the country is being evaluated and a transition agenda has been proposed with deadlines including the drafting of a new constitution, reform of the electoral commission, a law on the moralization of political life, the organization of presidential, legislative and communal elections at the end of the transition. The Swedish Embassy will appreciate all these actions and decide.
